title: Hungry Games
description: Use https://www.spikeybot.com/hg/ if commands are too hard.

rows.description: Automatically start the game and continue until the game is completely over.

examples.result: Autoplay is enabled, if a game is not in progress, it will be created and started.

rows.description: Pause the game and immediately stop sending messages without ending the game entirely.

examples.result: The current day will be paused and can then be resumed with `hg resume` or `hg next`.

rows.description: This will start a game with your settings, but waits until you tell it to start the bloodbath.

examples.result: If you use Autoplay, this isn't necessary. Starts the game, but doesn't start the first day automatically.

rows.description: This will end a game early.

examples.result: The game will be aborted, and completely stopped and cannot be restarted.

rows.description: Simulate the next day of the Games!
You shouldn't need to use this. But it will force a new game to be created, and update players for a new game.
List options if no name, or change the option if you give a name.
rows.aliases: options, option, opt, opts, settings, setting, set

examples.result: All changeable options, their current values, and a description will be sent. Change pages by clicking on the reactions.
Bots will be allowed in the games.
The probability of an arena event will be set to 10%.
The relative probability of a player being killed will become 50.

rows.description: Rename the game to your own custom name. The default is "{SERVER NAME}'s Hungry Games". The custom name must be 100 characters or fewer.

examples.result: The name of the game will be changed to "My Super Cool Game"
The game will return to using the server's name as the name of future games.

rows.description: Delete data about the Games. Don't choose an option for more info.

examples.result: Bot will send resettable values and a little info about each.

Bot will delete all data about the games in this server. This cannot be undone.
(Includes custom game events. When I say all, I mean all data.)
Bot will delete all custom events. This cannot be undone.
Bot will delete all data about the current game that may be paused. This should only be useful if data becomes corrupted.
All options will be reset to their default values. This cannot be undone.
Bot will delete teams and automatically re-create them with the current settings.
Bot will remove all users from both blacklist and whitelist and reset them with the current game settings.

rows.description: This will list all players I currently care about.
Prevent someone from being added to the next game.

examples.result: SpikeyRobot will not participate in the next game that is started. He will not be removed from a game that is currently in progress.
SpikeyRobot and SpikeyBot will not participate in the next game that is started. They will not be removed from a game that is currently in progress.
All users will be removed from the next games.
All users who are currently online will be added to the next games (Does not exclude idle or dnd).
All offline users will be removed from the next games.
All users who are currently idle will be removed.
All users who are currently in DND will be removed.
All NPCs who are currently included will be removed.

rows.description: Add a person back into the next game.

examples.result: SpikeyRobot will participate in the next game that is started. He will not be added to a game that is currently in progress.
SpikeyRobot and SpikeyBot will participate in the next game that is started. They will not be added to a game that is currently in progress.
All users will be added to the next games.
All users who are currently online will be added to the next games (Does not include idle or dnd).
All offline users will be added to the next games.
All users who are currently idle will be added.
All users who are currently in DND will be added.
All NPCs who are currently excluded will be added.

rows.description: Allow players to join a game by adding reactions to a message.

examples.result: A message will be sent, and those who add a reaction to it, will be included in the next game. Everyone else is excluded.
There are 2 ways to end the reaction message. Type the command again, or just start the game.

rows.description: This will list all players I currently care about.
rows.aliases: npc, ai, npcs, ais, bots, bot

examples.result: All currently created NPCs will be listed.

examples.command: npc That One Cool NPC I Have
examples.result: All known information about "THat One Cool NPC I Have" will be shown. NPC ID can also be used instead of name.

rows.description: Prevent an NPC from being added to the next game.

examples.result: The NPC named 'MyCoolNPC' will be removed from future games.
An NPC with the same ID will not be included in future games.

rows.description: Allow an NPC to be added to the next game.

examples.result: The NPC named 'MyCoolNPC' will be added into future games.
An NPC with the same ID will be included in future games.

rows.description: Create an NPC.

examples.result: The NPC named 'SB 2' will be created using the image downloaded from spikeybot.com.
The NPC named 'New Best Friend' will be created using an image attached to the message. The command is the 'Description' part when uploading an image to Discord.

rows.description: Delete an NPC.

examples.result: The NPC named 'MyCoolNPC' will be deleted without confirmation. If there are multiple NPCs named MyCoolNPC, the bot will pick one at random. To avoid deleting the wrong one, use the NPC's ID instead.

examples.description: Delete an NPC using its ID
examples.result: The NPC with the same ID will be deleted without confirmation.

rows.description: This will swap two players to the other team.

examples.result: SpikeyRobot will be put on SpikeyBot's Team, and SpikeyBot will be put on SpikeyRobot's original team.

rows.description: This will move the first player, to another team. (Ignores teamSize option)

examples.result: SpikeyRobot will be put on Team 2 even if the team is full.
SpikeyRobot will be put on the team that SpikeyBot is on even if the team is full.

rows.description: Rename a team. Specify its id, or mention someone on a team.

examples.result: Team 3 will be called "The Bestest Team".

examples.command: team rename @SpikeyRobot The Greatest Team Ever!!!
examples.result: The team that SpikeyRobot is on will be called "The Greatest Team Ever!!!".

rows.description: Randomize who is on what team.

examples.result: All teams will be reset, and users will be swapped at random to make entirely new teams.

rows.description: Delete all teams and start over.

examples.result: All teams will be reset.

rows.description: This will list all custom events that could happen in the game. The HG Webview page can be much easier to use.

examples.result: Message with list of all events will be sent. Use arrow reactions to change page, circle arrows to change event type.

rows.description: Begins process of adding a custom event. Not all event types can be created yet due to the complications of making a UI. The HG Webview page can be much easier to use, and supports more types.

examples.result: Edit the message you sent until the examples look correct to you, then use the reactions on the bot's message to continue event creation.

rows.description: Remove a custom event. The number is the number shown in the list of events.

examples.result: Start to delete custom event #10, click the reactions to choose which type of event this was.

rows.description: Show all tracked stats about players.

examples.result: Lifetime, previous game, and the selected group stats for the user who ran the command will be sent.
Tracked stats for SpikeyRobot will be sent.

rows.description: This will cause players to end the current or next day as dead.

examples.result: A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that kills SpikeyRobot if he is not already dead.
A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that kills SpikeyRobot and SpikeyBot if they are not already dead.
All groups that the include and exclude commands support, this also supports (online, offline, idle, dnd, everyone, bots, npcs).

rows.description: This will cause players to end the current or next day as wounded.
rows.aliases: wound, hurt, damage, stab, punch, slap, injure

examples.result: A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that wounds SpikeyRobot if he is not already wounded.
A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that wounds SpikeyRobot and SpikeyBot if they are not already wounded.
All groups that the include and exclude commands support, this also supports (online, offline, idle, dnd, everyone, bots, npcs).

rows.description: This will cause players to end the current or next day as alive and fully healed.

examples.result: A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that resurrects or heals SpikeyRobot if he is not already fully healed.
A message will be added to the current day or the next day, that heals SpikeyRobot and SpikeyBot if they are not already fully healed.
All groups that the include and exclude commands support, this also supports (online, offline, idle, dnd, everyone, bots, npcs).
